appearances.title: CNN News Central : CNNW : January 5, 2026 5:00am-6:01am PST
appearances.snippet: . >> joining us now for more on all of this is democratic congresswoman madeleine dean of pennsylvaniats on the house foreign affairs committee. congresswoman, thank you for being here. i want to jump off of something that you said this weekend. after this operation, this capture of maduro and his wife. do you think that president trump just started a war? >> sadly. >> it appears he has. >> and in his statement to the press, he said this was a military operation. so it was incredibly troubling to me, that the president did it in this way. and i want to make sure i say that i have no love loss for maduro. good riddance to him. may he be brought to justice. but the way the president has gone about this has been very chaotic. not the military piece. the military did a brilliant job, but the president literally dropped into a sovereign nation, executed on this warrant, pulled the leader out with no plan for the next day. >> marco rubio says that they did not need to tell congress beforehand, his argument being that one. he said he was concerned about leaks, but that falls apart pretty quic

appearances.title: Ana Cabrera Reports : MSNOW : January 16, 2026 7:00am-9:00am PST
appearances.snippet: democrat madeleine dean of pennsylvania. congresswoman, it's great to have you with us. taking the time. what's your message to danish officials today? >> well, thank you for covering this. and i'm on a very special trip, ten of us from both the senate and the house, and importantly, two republican senators, as your reporting shows, senator tillis, but also lisa murkowski, senator murkowski. and they have had very powerful words here. we've had the opportunity to meet with the prime minister of denmark, the prime minister. these are private meetings, the prime minister of greenland. and then we just came from, forgive me, a very large meeting of members of parliament from both greenland and from denmark. we also had lunch with a bunch of industry folks. and i have to tell you, their hospitality is so warm, but they're very puzzled. they believe that we are the strongest of allies. we have a 225 year relationship, 80 years in nato, denmark a founding member, and greenland is a nato member. so they're puzzled. they're dismayed. they don't understand it. i think our message

appearances.title: The Beat With Ari Melber : MSNOW : January 6, 2026 3:00pm-4:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: democratic congressman madeleine dean served as the january 6th impeachment manager. that was for the second impeachment after the january 6th attack. thank you for being here. i wonder if first, you might share any of your reflections just on hearing and seeing that video again of both the republicans, your colleagues, but also the president claiming at the time, donald trump, that these were heinous acts of violence and people should pay. >> well, i thank you, ari, for being sure to cover and remember this day. we have to continue to remember this day and call it out for the atrocious insurrection incited by a sitting president, that it was an attack on this citadel, this seat of power that is such an important representation of american strength and democracy and justice. i was here five years ago. i was up in the gallery with many other members and actually members of the press as well. when all hell broke loose. i was also in the hearing today and very glad to hear the testimony of many folks. i won't spend one minute on those who came to commemorate their violen
